IP2025042_syn_2:
PROCEDURE: Whole Lung Lavage (Right).
CLINICAL CONTEXT: 39M with autoimmune Pulmonary Alveolar Proteinosis. 
DETAILS: Following induction of general anesthesia, a 39 Fr left-sided double-lumen endotracheal tube was placed and isolation confirmed via bronchoscopy. The patient was placed on single-lung ventilation. The right lung was systematically lavaged with 32 liters of warmed normal saline in 1-liter aliquots. Effluent transitioned from opaque/milky to clear. Total fluid recovery was 27 liters. Hemodynamics were managed with vasopressors for transient hypotension. The patient was transferred to the ICU intubated.

IP2025042_syn_6: Right whole lung lavage for pulmonary alveolar proteinosis was performed on a 39-year-old male. General anesthesia with a 39 Fr left-sided double-lumen tube was utilized for single-lung ventilation of the left lung. The right lung was lavaged with warmed saline aliquots of 800–1000 mL. The total instilled volume was 32 L and total effluent was 27 L. The fluid progressively cleared. A brief episode of hypotension was treated with a vasopressor bolus. Oxygenation remained adequate. The patient remained intubated and was transferred to the ICU.

IP2025042_syn_8: [REDACTED] a whole lung washing (lavage) of his right lung today to treat his proteinosis condition. We used a special breathing tube to breathe for his left lung while we filled and emptied his right lung with saline. We used a total of 32 liters of fluid, and by the end, the fluid coming out looked much clearer than the milky fluid at the start. His blood pressure dipped once but recovered quickly. He is going to the ICU on a ventilator to recover.

IP2025042:
Whole Lung Lavage Procedure Note
Procedure: Right whole lung lavage for pulmonary alveolar proteinosis
Patient: [REDACTED], 39-year-old male with autoimmune PAP, status post left lung lavage 3 weeks prior.
Anesthesia: General anesthesia with 39 Fr left-sided double-lumen tube, single-lung ventilation of left lung.
Lavage details: Right lung lavaged with warmed saline aliquots of 800–1000 mL. Total instilled volume 32 L; total effluent 27 L of progressively clearing milky fluid.
Complications: Brief episode of hypotension treated with vasopressor bolus; oxygenation adequate throughout.
Disposition: Remained intubated postprocedure and transferred to ICU on mechanical ventilation.
